newsitem.title: USA: No major changes seen in upcoming cobalt offering.
newsitem.headline: No major changes seen in upcoming cobalt offering.

text.p: The U.S. Defense National Stockpile Center foresees only minor changes to the upcoming sealed bid solicitation for the latest cobalt offering sometime in September.
The Stockpile hasn't nailed down a date for the bid, but expects to offer 500,000 pounds of cobalt before the end of the fiscal year ending September 30.

"We plan on issuing an ammendment to the previous solicitation," June Olmsted, the cobalt contracting officer for the Stockpile told Reuters. "The only changes will be the amount we're offering and the removal schedules."
She said no changes were planned on the recently-changed assaying provision, which incited the ire of Minor Metals Inc., in the last sealed bid announced August 8.

In the last sealed bid, the Stockpile called on the Minor Metals Trade Association to sample and analyze 25 percent of the material for sale, the first time the Stockpile invited an independent analysis of its cobalt.

Minor Metals criticized the Stockpile in an open letter for not sampling the entire amount, saying the provision leaves traders exposed to considerable risk if the material doesn't conform to the analysis.
